page.title: 06Cowdenbeath Constabulary
page.content: Cowdenbeath Constabulary consists of 65 police officers. The Constabulary has 8 vehicles consisting of 2 vans, 1 motorcycle and 5 cars. There are 12 cells with space for 36 prisoners. To join Cowdenbeath Police Force a male has to be over 5' 8" or over 5'4" for a female. The Constabulary covers a wide area including Kelty, Lochgelly, Lumphinnans, Lochore, Crossgates, Ballingry, Hill of Beath and Aberdour. In 1983 the total no. of crimes for this area was 3042 and a year later it was 3197. Assault ratings have increased by 6 and thefts/break-ins are the most common crime.
